oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Special Order No. 35 from the headquarters in Jackson, Tennessee, concerning assessment to support Federal refugees
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. Users are solely responsible for determining the existence of such instances and for obtaining any other permissions and paying associated fees that may be necessary for the intended use.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865 -- Registers, lists, etc.; Tennessee -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Military orders; United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865 -- Refugees
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Special order issued by Colonel James M. True and Post Adjutant E. R. Wiley Jr. specifying the method of collecting assessments for the support of Federal refugees. The order includes a list of individuals with assessments against them and the amount each person owes.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: United States -- War Dept -- Adjutant-General's Office
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Tennessee Historical Society Civil War Collection, 1860-1982
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Special orders are comprised of commands related to specific actions to be taken within the units of troops specified in the order. Such orders can involve movements, actions, and transfers.
